data.description:
Latest update now available on IOS!

Analog watch face using only prime numbers on the dial.  If you look closely you will see that the numbers form an interesting pattern on the dial.  

Features
- Analog & digital time (honors 12/24 setting)
- Day & Date
- Bluetooth and battery indicators
- New! Light or dark screen
- New! Vib on disconnect
- New! Configurable settings

data.author: David Rodríguez Rincón

changelog.release_notes:
*YWeather is out of support from this release*
Thank you all for making this such as awesome journey. I'm releasing this latest version to fix the issues loading the setting page and free all the extra features. Special thanks to everybody supporting the project. You are simply the best.
- Fix Yahoo Weather geolocation

- Fix Yahoo! Weather temperature when displaying Feels Like on Celsius
- Add OpenWeatherMap as weather provider
- Add validations to the settings page to avoid submissions when weather provider is changed without entering a valid API key
- minor UI changes for Pebble Time Round

- Fix crash on Black and White devices when running disconnected from phone. 
- On Black and White devices the disconnection icon is replaced by the "NC" literal.

- Add seconds back (yay!). 
- Fix temperatures under 0 not always being displayed. 
- Add a patch to fix the Yahoo! Weather issue over GPS. 
- Fix an issue with the settings page not loading. 
- Fix an issue with refresh frequency setting causing a crazy battery drain. 
- Fix some typos with weekdays on Hungarian

- Pebble Time Round support
- Enhance look & feel for battery level
- Enhance BT indicator (now it only appears when disconnected)
- Full chinese/japanese support

- Add Russian support
-  (New update: 27/01/2016 - Fix Yahoo! Weather on GPS for legacy users)

If you see this as the current version, you are not running the latest firmare. Please follow this link to upgrade your Pebble fw and keep enjoying the latest upgrades: http://help.getpebble.com/customer/portal/articles/2237472-updated-software-for-classic-pebbles?b_id=8309

- Fix the issue with the settings page
- Add back the Invert Colors (for Original Pebble and Pebble Steel only)
- Add color!! Pebble Time compatible
- fix the crash issue on v2.6 (SORRY!!!)

- Weather Provider Selection - Extend the backlight duration to display all the forecast info - Replace Moon phase with Rain Probability (not available on Yahoo! Weather) - Add the option to keep the watch vibatring when connection is lost until it reconnect. - Fix bugs

- Allow to turn off the Forecast screen
- Option to show/hide battery level
- Remove the 24H indicator
- Add m/sec and knots for wind speed
- Add Hourly Vibe quiet hours

- Fix Geolocation issue with Flickr
- Fix Wednesday on 3-days forecast screen 
- Fix the v2.4 label 
- Add Romanian support

- Display seconds 
- Displays the AM/PM/24H indicator 
- Hourly Vibe 
- Romanian support
- Fix Key decrypt process for iPhone 6 users.

- Add Extra Features
- Fix bugs
- Enhance Moonphase

- Add SSL connection to Flickr service
- Add Slovak support
- Add validation to avoid the app crash when selecting a non compatible language
- Add Japanese support

- Fix temperature over 100ºF 
- Makes moon phase looks better
- Display extended window at double tap (preliminary version)
- Fix Double Free memory issue when disconnecting BT

data.description:
**NOTE: Yahoo Weather seems to be not working randomly. Switching to any other weather provider is highly recommended.

***********************************************************
The most loved watchface for Pebble is now color!

Display the current weather conditions and the forecast for the day by shaking your wrist twice. Optionally you can get the 3 day forecast by backing the project.


YWeather tells you the time in 21 languages: english, spanish, italian, catalan, chinese, czech, danish, dutch, finnish, french, german, hungarian, japanese, norwegian, polish, portuguese, romanian, russian, slovak, swedish and turkish.

Get the info than you want, displayed in the right way.

latest_release.release_notes:
*YWeather is out of support from this release*
Thank you all for making this such as awesome journey. I'm releasing this latest version to fix the issues loading the setting page and free all the extra features. Special thanks to everybody supporting the project. You are simply the best.

data.title: YWeather

data.description:
Displays current status of your Bitcoin mining rig.

FEATURES:
- Alerts when a worker goes offline
- Update intervals from 1 minute to 60 minutes
- Payout progress indicator
- Flick to update option
- Light and Dark theme
- Battery and Bluetooth indicator

Currently supports Slush's pool.

Email me if you wish to request support for other pools.

Increase timeout from 10 to 30 seconds
Update settings to show installed version

data.author: Graphware Corp.

changelog.release_notes: Minor update, clean up.
This version of Digital Modern displays the date, time, and battery status. It uses a large, easy-to-read font for the time.

data.description: This is a digital watch face with a modern twist. It contains the date and the day of the week in a modern font. The time is shown in a large, easy-to-read font with 1-second resolution. It also has a battery indicator to let you know how much charge is left in your watch as well as to let you know when the watch is charging. It supports 24-hour mode and a black or white background.
data.title: Digital Modern

changelog.release_notes: completely configurable version!
- previous version was with java?!?!?
- removed size by allowing only numbers (and '*')in the fonts and removed all memory leaks!
- prevent blank screen on start
- added animation
- fixed an issue where the screen stayed black after switchin watchfaces while there was no BT connection

- new font (easier to read)
- not happy with the lines next to the digital time though :(

- changed coordinates of barcode
- removed leading 0 in 12h mode
- made the barcode "overlap" the time a bit

data.description:
Scannable real-time barcode [3of9] with digital time [OCR-B] in 12h and 24h mode (depending on the settings of your Pebble!) with nice animation on minute change! 

♥ UPDATE -> v2.0
FULLY CONFIGURABLE VERSION!
now you can:
- change colour
- set disconnection behaviour
- add 'second blink'


SUGGESTIONS WELCOME!
data.title: BARCODE39

data.author: ttmm
data.description: Time is not a straight line: it is constantly curving. Once you count all the sections, then you will know what the time is. Small lines mark a five minute period. Three lines connected stand for the quarter. This one is for true aliens. More cool watchfaces www.ttmm.eu
data.title: TTMMLINE

data.author: ttmm
data.description: Geometrically shaped time. A single dotted triangle represents one o clock. Size and the position of the united triangles show the hours. It gives to our obvious times a more magical and glamourous look. More cool watchfaces www.ttmm.eu
data.title: 123TMM

data.description:
Basic Watchface with weather, date, time, and location displayed easily. If you have any suggestions or things I could do differently feel free to contact me with your ideas.

With my app on iPhone for the weather to update while the phone is locked you must make sure that Background app-refresh for the Pebble app is on and Location Services for the Pebble app is on.

data.author: Seaware

changelog.release_notes: Version 1.6 fixes an issue that causes the watchface to change to GMT for some users rather than staying on the local timezone.
Fixed local time calculation due to time zone differences in Pebble's SDK3
Added Pebble Time Round support, more time zones, better local time tracking, and optional weekday display.

This v1.3 release changes to a more dependable source of GMT for timezone calculations. The prior versions used a less reliable server. If you have experienced more than one timezone shifting by several hours, then this update is for you! The Casablanca timezone has also been updated to include daylight savings time which is in effect.
Fixed minor am/pm bug.

data.description: Do you travel or work with people in other time zones? This watchface displays up to 5 time zones around the world. It also has an optional date in 5 languages. It synchronizes to GMT and keeps track of daylight saving time rules in each region. You can also adjust the background color and it works in 12 or 24 hour modes.

latest_release.release_notes: Version 1.6 fixes an issue that causes the watchface to change to GMT for some users rather than staying on the local timezone.

data.title: World Watch

data.author: David Gölzhäuser
data.description: HexWatch is a simple watchface that displays the current time in a hexadecimal format, so you either can look like a geek or practice your hex skills. And yes, there is a validation clock to check your calculations. In addition you can see the current percentage level of your watch and a charching symbol on the upper right corner.
data.title: HexWatch

changelog.release_notes: Version 1.1: Added smoothing to sine curves such that the sine curve is seamless at higher amplitudes.
Version 1.0

data.description:
New for Version 1.1: Sine waves are now smoothed and seamless at higher amplitudes!

Shows an oscilloscope wave-generator, where there are 3 waves displayed.
-The minutes wave: the fastest moving one
-The hours wave: the slowest one
-and an additional waveform which displays the average of the others

You can tell time through the amplitude of the respective waves on the built-in scales!

latest_release.release_notes: Version 1.1: Added smoothing to sine curves such that the sine curve is seamless at higher amplitudes.

data.title: Oscilloscope

data.description:
Show time in Traditional Chinese and Simplified Chinese calligraphy, along with optional digital time display.

It features phone anti-theft, by vibrating the watch in a unique pattern when the phone bluetooth is disconnected (phone is away from the watch).

Provides the user the option to show/hide battery/bluetooth indicators.

Send feedback and suggestions to nebitrams@gmail.com

latest_release.release_notes:
1. Added digital time at the bottom left as optional feature.
2. Fixed the bluetooth icon bug when inverting watch colour.

data.title: Chinese Clock

data.description:
Sick of people peeping at the time on your watch.

Get this watchface, they can only see the word "STOP PEEPING", not the time.

You are still able to see the time at bottom right corner.

It also shows the battery power level at the bottom left corner.  If bluetooth is disconnected, "disconnected" will be shown on top of the watchface.

Please email feedback to nebitrams@gmail.com.
data.title: Peeping TOM

data.description:
Added just a touch of colour.

Battery level is represented by the building lights, and the small number on the left.  As battery runs down more lights go out.

97-100%  all lights on
81-96 most lights on
61-80 bit more than half lights on
41-60 less than half lights on
21-40 some lights on
0-20 no lights on (buildings all black - time to charge!)
data.title: City Lights with weather

other similar designs are '90degrees C' and '0degreesTemp'.

data.author: SeaPea Software

changelog.release_notes: Yahoo Weather is back as the default weather provider, however OpenWeatherMap is still available in the settings. I find Yahoo Weather to be more accurate than OWM, but OWM has forecast timings for rain, snow, etc.
Fixed saving settings on Android
Switched steps average on supported Pebbles to use the same day average, instead of either weekday or weekend average, to match the Pebble Health app better.

Fixed weather not downloading all the time.
Added time period in weather description for weather conditions such as rain, snow, etc.
Added optional week number display in place of the AM/PM indicator.
For color Pebble's that support Pebble Health, optionally shows steps progress vs. daily average behind the status bar text similar to the progress bar in the Pebble Health app (blue color indicates steps below daily average, green color indicates today's steps are above average, and the orange line shows the daily average steps at the present time of day)
Finally should have fixed saving settings on Android
Some more bug fixes. Another attempt to fix issue with Android not saving settings.

Corrected frequency of forecast data fetches.
Possibly fixed Android settings not taking effect.
Improved High/Low forecast summarization.

Changed weather data provider to OpenWeatherMap and revamped config to use offline framework.
As a result of the provider change, current weather is now fixed at updating every hour and forecast data updates every 3 hours.
Also to reduce weather data fetches, Quiet Time was implemented and weather is not fetched by default during this time, which can be configured in the ForeCal settings. This change along with others meant it was simpler to reset the config, so you may need to change the configuration back to how you like it if you used ForeCal before.
Implemented workaround for Yahoo service for getting WOEID.
Fixed crash from double free bug
Now ignores stale weather data so that it doesn't show incorrect current conditions and keeps the forecast showing. (Yahoo weather has recently been intermittently serving data up to 1 week old)
Fixed Black on White mode.
Added Pebble Time Round support
Another BT connection status fix
A few minor fixes for the BT connection status
Improved timing for fetching weather data so that it doesn't fetch when going out and back into the watch face rapidly like when checking the Timeline.
Reworked settings to be more robust
Squashed a few bugs in the calendar and settings

Added a dash of color for Pebble Time
Also added settings for showing wind speed instead of the current day name and change the date format.

Fixed weather location when there are multiple results from Yahoo for a fixed location (just picks the 1st result.)
Also fixed decoding of XML entities in weather/location data.

data.description:
Displays today's/tomorrow's forecast with a 3 week calendar always on screen. (No need to flick wrist or tap to get to another view)

Now with color!

- Current details: Time, date, Battery, Bluetooth Status, Current Temp. and optionally wind speed and week number
- Weather Forecast for either current GPS location or fixed location: Today/Tomorrow's High, Low, Conditions, Sunrise/Sunset
- 3-week Calendar (Can set 1st day of week and show last week, this week, & next week or this week + next 2 weeks)

- Optionally display steps progress as a blue/green bar behind the Today/Tomorrow text versus your average steps for each day as an orange line
- Uses 12/24 hour setting from Pebble's settings
- Can auto select temperature units or set preferred units
- Automatically shows tomorrow's forecast after set time (6pm by default)
- 2 long vibrations on BT disconnect, 1 short vibrate on connect (can be turned off)
- Auto 'Daymode' (black on white during daytime, white on black during night) or color scheme can be manually set

Weather data is from Yahoo/OpenWeatherMap. Icons are based on the set by Meteocons.

latest_release.release_notes: Yahoo Weather is back as the default weather provider, however OpenWeatherMap is still available in the settings. I find Yahoo Weather to be more accurate than OWM, but OWM has forecast timings for rain, snow, etc.

data.title: ForeCal (Weather Forecast & Calendar)

data.description: Shows much time to go until a date in the future, or since a date in the past. Useful to mark important upcoming milestones i.e. days until the big day, an important birthday or anniversary, when you are expecting, days until or since Christmas, or whatever you want. Configurable. You can track up to 30 dates. Shake your wrist to switch between the different countdowns.
data.title: Countdown

data.description: What time is it on Mars? The Mars Watch is a convenient watchface for both Earth and Mars time. When you turn your wrist, the time and Sol for the Curiosity and Opportunity rovers slides into view. Synchronized to UTC, Mars times are derived from NASA standards. The watch face can have a black or white background and supports 5 languages.

latest_release.release_notes: v1.1 - Minor adjustment to JS configuration

data.title: Mars Watch

data.description:
The Pebble Terminal turns your watch into a Linux terminal and uses the `date` command to print the time and day.

Features:
Larger time and date text than the competition!
Familiar Linux syntax.
Real time typing of the commands every minute
Blinking cursor to indicate seconds

Keywords: bash, shell, linux, unix, terminal, command line, commands

latest_release.release_notes: Mostly backend changes, the app is much more organized now. Gearing up for more features soon.

data.author: MMazzocchi
data.description:
Have your watch show the time in periodic entries with the Periodic watchface! The hour and time is displayed with the chemical number, symbol, name, and atomic weight. Probably not the best face if you need the time fast, but perfect if you've got the first 59 elements memorized (or want to learn)!  Now animated!

The atomic weight for Sodium had to be rounded, and "Nuetronium" is element zero.
data.title: Periodic

data.description:
Pebble Watchface designs with triangular rectangular and curved digits.
The hours are on the top right and the minutes are on the bottom left part of the display while upper left is the mirrored hours and lower right is the mirrored minutes.

The times displayed here 19:14, 12:21, 17:36, 17:15 triangular,  07:46, 14:37 rectangular and 20:22 curved.

With many options to invert the display.
data.title: Rorschach2
